doc.str: An apparatus for sonoporation comprising an ultrasound source and positioning means such as an optical trap, magnetic field or electrical field for positioning one or more microbubbles at a predetermined distance (Z axis) from a surface. In use, the ultrasound source produces an ultrasound signal capable of rupturing the one or more microbubbles when the one or more microbubbles is held at said predetermined position in order to mark, etch or puncture the surface.

PRENTICE P, MACDONALD M P; CUSCHIERI A., DHOLAKIA K, CAMPBELL P: "Real time observation of the ultrasound stimulated disintegration of optically trapped microbubbles in proximity to biological cells" PROC SPIE INT SOC OPT ENG JUL 31-AUG 4 2005, vol. 5930, August 2005 (2005-08), pages 1-8, XP008071951 United States & DATABASE COMPENDEX [Online] 26 August 2005 (2005-08-26), retrieved from SPIE DIGITAL LIBRARY Database accession no. 10.1117/12.615012 | PRENTICE P A, MACDONALD M P, FRANK T G, CUSCHIERE A, SPALDING G C, SIBBETT W, CAMPBELL P A, DHOLAKIA K: "Manipulation and filtration of low index particles with holographic Laguerre-Gaussian optical trap arrays" OPTICS EXPRESS, vol. 12, no. 4, 2004, pages 593-600, XP008071961
UNIVERSITY OF DUNDEE | CAMPBELL, PAUL, A. | PRENTICE, PAUL, A.
